newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-FEYENOORD, CELTIC TO DISCUSS VAN HOOIJDONK DEAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FEYENOORD, CELTIC TO DISCUSS VAN HOOIJDONK DEAL.

text.p: Dutch title-chasers Feyenoord will talk to Scotland's Glasgow Celtic on Friday about a possible transfer deal which would take unsettled Netherlands striker Pierre van Hooijdonk back home.
"I will be speaking to Celtic tomorrow to discuss the conditions to bring Pierre van Hooijdonk to Feyenoord," the Dutch club's chairman Jorien van den Herik said on Thursday.
Feyenoord originally wanted the player on loan, but now a permanent move might be on if they can meet Celtic's asking price, expected to be in the region of four million pounds ($6.6 million).

"When our attempt to get him on loan fell through, we let Celtic know that we'd be interested in buying him," van den Herik was quoted as saying by Dutch daily Algemeen Dagblad. "That doesn't now look impossible."

Van Hooijdonk joined Celtic from NAC Breda for 1.5 million pounds ($2.5 million) in January 1995. He has scored more than 50 goals during his two years in Scotland and is Celtic's top scorer this season with 11 strikes from 15 starts.
But he had several clashes with manager Tommy Burns over everything from his salary to his attitude.

He reportedly angered Celtic by deriding a wage offer of 7,000 pounds ($11,600) a week as "enough for the homeless but not for a top international striker" and snubbed Burns in September by refusing to warm up for a UEFA Cup match in Hamburg.
This week he allegedly refused to have an injection for a groin injury received while on international duty.
